title: Robert Pattinson already has his Batman voice for iconic role
text:
Robert has already been working on his Batman voice (Picture: Rex Features)

Robert Pattinson is taking his upcoming role of Batman with everything he has, already getting the voice downpat.

As he prepares to take on the iconic comic book character, the star has revealed the inspiration behind the voice of the Caped Crusader.

In the past other actors, including Christian Bale and George Clooney, have taken on a deep, often raspy tone to bring Batman to life.

When it comes to Rob’s take on the character, he’s found inspiration in his The Lighthouse co-star Willem Dafoe.

In an interview with Access Hollywood, the Twilight actor was asked if he’d already practiced his Batman voice, a very important factor in the film.

With the journalist mentioning Willem’s ‘gritty’ voice, Robert said: ‘Willem’s voice in this was quite inspiring for it, to be honest. It is pretty similar, the voice I’m gonna do, to Willem’s.’

Well that’s a pretty special insight into how RPatz is taking on the role, if we do say so ourselves.

Adding a pirate’s ‘Aaargh!’, the star had a laugh as he said: ‘I think Batman has a sort of piratey kind of voice – I think that will really suit it.’

So it seems he’s taking the mick here and we’re not all that sure he’s going to be riffing on his co-star’s tone any time soon, but it’s made us no less amped for the project.

And if you needed a little refresher on what Willem sounds like in The Lighthouse, have a goose and a gander at the trailer one more time:

Rob took inspiration from Willem

Back to the B-Man, Matt Reeves is set to direct the anticipated blockbuster after taking over from Ben Affleck who stepped down in 2017. Ben also departed his role as Batman after Justice League leaving a big space for Reeves to pick a new hero.

R-Patz was confirmed as the new Batman in May and admitted it was a dream come true to don Batman’s famous cape.

Speaking to Variety, Robert said: ‘I’d had Batman in my mind for a while.

‘It’s such an absurd thing to say. I sort of had an idea to do it, and I’d been prodding Matt [Reeves]. I kept asking to meet him.’

Although, he was ‘furious’ when the news leaked as he hadn’t even auditioned for the role.

He said: ‘When that thing leaked, I was f*****g furious. Everyone was so upset. Everyone was panicking from my team. I sort of thought that had blown up the whole thing.’

The Batman is set to hit cinemas on 25 June 2021.
